title: How do atoms vibrate? Do they vibrate 2 dimensionally (back and forth) or do they vibrate 3 dimensionally (pulsating)? - Quora

response.answer_text: “How do atoms vibrate? Do they vibrate 2 dimensionally (back and forth) or do they vibrate 3 dimensionally (pulsating)?” Atoms do not vibrate mechanically, though molecules do. A diatomic molecule can only vibrate by changing its bond length. This is back and forth, but 1 dimensional. Polyatomic molecule can “breathe” (expand and shrink), flex, and otherwise periodically distort their shapes in various ways. When one speaks of atoms vibrating, it can be allegorical, like to a clock pendulum when describing an atomic clock. In this case, the magnetic direction of an electron oscillates, which is not a mechanical movement.
Atoms don’t vibrate it’s the energy within them and it has no dimension it vibrates in multiple directions and dimensions all at once, the atom is just it’s vessel.
